item.title: For Jews in Minnesota, the festival of Tu Bishvat takes on a new meaning this year
item.description: Rabbis in Minneapolis reflect on the agricultural holiday of Tu Bishvat and what it means for the city after the killings by ICE agents.

item.title: 'Ye Gods' asks guests where their moral compass comes from
item.description: What does it mean to have faith, and where do our moral codes come from? Scott Carter of 'Ye Gods' podcast tries to tackle these big questions.
item.content:encoded: What does it mean to have faith, and where do our moral codes come from? Scott Carter of 'Ye Gods' podcast tries to tackle these big questions.

item.title: Church protest leads to debate among Christians about the morality of working for ICE
item.description: Protesters recently interrupted service at a Twin Cities church because one of the pastors works for ICE. That's led some Christians to debate whether working for ICE aligns with their values.
item.content:encoded: Protesters recently interrupted service at a Twin Cities church because one of the pastors works for ICE. That's led some Christians to debate whether working for ICE aligns with their values.

item.title: Maine immigrants protected by "God squad"
item.description: Faith leaders in Maine are trying to protect immigrants from being taken into ICE custody. The so-called "God squad" forms a human barrier to protect employees arriving to work at a local factory.

item.title: Why 3 Catholic cardinals released a statement critical of Trump's foreign policy
item.description: Cardinal Blase Cupich of Chicago tells NPR's Scott Simon why he and two other Catholic cardinals released a statement critical of the Trump administration's foreign policy.
item.content:encoded: Cardinal Blase Cupich of Chicago tells NPR's Scott Simon why he and two other Catholic cardinals released a statement critical of the Trump administration's foreign policy.

item.title: Top U.S. archbishops denounce American foreign policy
item.description: The three most-senior cardinals leading U.S. archdioceses issued the rebuke in a joint statement on Monday, saying recent policies have thrown America's "moral role in confronting evil" into question.

item.title: Amid ICE clashes, New Hampshire bishop urges clergy to prepare their wills
item.description: The Episcopal bishop of New Hampshire told priests protesting ICE to get their wills and affairs in order. Some praise the bishop, while other priests say they never signed up to be martyrs.

item.title: 'You need to find joy together,' says leader of Beth Israel synagogue's religious school after arson attack
item.description: A week after an arson fire at Mississippi's oldest synagogue, Rachel Myers, a leader of the congregation's religious school, talks about how the congregation is doing and about this weekend's services.

item.title: How Minnesota faith communities are resisting aggressive immigration operations
item.description: As immigration enforcement actions have ramped up in Minnesota, people of faith have been at the forefront of the response to ICE detentions and the killing of Renee Macklin Good by a federal agent.

item.title: FBI: Mississippi arson suspect confessed to torching synagogue and targeting Jews
item.description: The FBI says an arson suspect in a fire that nearly destroyed a synagogue in Jackson confessed, citing the building's 'Jewish ties'. The Ku Klux Klan bombed the synagogue in 1967.
